comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Building in the distance on the left is Sydney Hospital

comment.author: 46164991@N03
comment._content: My grandfather was an outdoor works supervisor for the City of Sydney, and was involved in the replacement and eventual removal of woodblock paving. Even up to the late 20th century, there were major streets in Sydney with woodblocks beneath the surface - a hole in the tar surface at the corner of Elizabeth and Foveaux revealed this during the early-mid 70's. Have added notes to the photograph identifying three significant Macquarie St buildings, of which only Wyoming remains.

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: I take it the fellow in the white shirt is using a crow bar to wedge in a final piece. What a job!!
